decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Teferi, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Solitude and Fatal Push, while also utilizing flicker effects with Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to gain additional value from its creatures. The deck also includes mana fixing lands like Marsh Flats and Flooded Strand to ensure it can cast its spells consistently and efficiently.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with an aggressive strategy. By utilizing artifacts and efficient creatures, the deck aims to control the board while maintaining a strong offensive presence. The inclusion of cards like Thoughtcast and Mox Opal allow for card advantage and ramp, while cards like Kappa Cannoneer and Salvage Titan provide powerful threats. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pithing Needle and Engineered Explosives to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Ultimately, the key strategy is to quickly build a strong board presence and apply pressure to the opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using cards like Prismatic Ending and Consign to Memory to deal with threats, as well as disruptive creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler and Starfield Shepherd, the deck can control the pace of the game. With efficient removal spells and powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Guide of Souls, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own strategy. The mana base is designed to support the deck's game plan and ensure consistent casting of spells.

This deck utilizes artifact creatures and mana acceleration to quickly overwhelm opponents with a barrage of threats. By using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to power out early threats like Memnite and Ornithopter, the deck can quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure to the opponent. Thoughtcast and Mishra's Bauble provide card advantage to keep the threats coming, while Urza's Saga and Pinnacle Emissary provide additional value and flexibility. Engineered Explosives and Shadowspear offer removal and disruption options, adding another layer of versatility to the deck.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Broodscale Bloodchief's ability to create and control an army of Eldrazi creatures, while using various cards such as Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Emrakul, the Promised End for additional control and win conditions. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Ugin's Labyrinth and Eldrazi Temple helps to ramp up mana production for playing high-cost creatures like Devourer of Destiny. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruption spells.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disruption spells. By using cards like Chalice of the Void to hinder the opponent's spells, Eldrazi Temple for quick mana acceleration, and powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Sire of Seven Deaths, this deck aims to apply pressure early and control the game. The mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells make it a challenging opponent to face in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

This deck focuses on disruptive creatures and spells to control the opponent's board while also applying pressure. By utilizing powerful control elements such as Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, along with efficient removal like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while consistently deploying threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also includes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to further disrupt the opponent's plans and protect its own game plan, ultimately aiming to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly playing artifacts to take advantage of affinity mechanics and swarm the opponent with fast and efficient creatures. It also includes cards that can disrupt the opponent's game plan and protect your own, while using artifacts that generate mana to power out your threats. The main goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap creatures and powerful artifact-based interactions, while controlling the board and protecting your key pieces to secure a rapid victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and card advantage engines to outmaneuver opponents and disrupt their game plan. It includes a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The key strategy is to control the board and the opponent's resources, while generating card advantage through cards like Orim's Chant and LÃ³rien Revealed. The deck aims to stall the game and outvalue the opponent until it can establish a dominant position and close out the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy revolves around efficient creature plays like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, supported by powerful spells such as Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. The inclusion of Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury adds a potent finisher to the deck. Additionally, cards like Goblin Bombardment and Arena of Glory provide additional ways to control the board and push for victory. The deck also features disruptive elements like Solitude and Voice of Victory to help maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. It utilizes Karn, the Great Creator to search for artifacts to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker provide disruption and card advantage, while Ugin, Eye of the Storms serves as a win condition. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger for a fast finish. Overall, the key concept is to control the game and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a board presence with cheap artifacts, while also utilizing card advantage with cards like Thoughtcast. Emry, Lurker of the Loch can help recur artifacts from the graveyard, while Kappa Cannoneer and Pinnacle Emissary provide additional threats. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to control the opponent's board. Urza's Saga is a key card that can generate additional threats and help ramp into bigger plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and spells.

This deck focuses on playing artifacts quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and disruptive spells. By utilizing cards like Urza's Saga, Mox Opal, and Mishra's Bauble, the deck aims to generate mana and card advantage while maintaining a steady stream of threats on the battlefield. The inclusion of removal spells like Engineered Explosives and Sink into Stupor helps control the opponent's board, allowing the deck to push through damage and close out the game quickly. The synergy between artifacts and Pinnacle Emissary/Words Manufacturing provides additional reach and resilience to the deck's aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on assembling the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful colorless spells and artifacts like Ugin, Karn, and Tezzeret, allowing the player to control the game and disrupt their opponent's strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to find the UrzaTron lands consistently. Ultimately, the goal is to establish control of the game through powerful threats and disruptive spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Goblin Charbelcher combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal. By utilizing cards like Hydroelectric Specimen and Tameshi, Reality Architect, the deck aims to control the board and protect its key pieces until it can win the game in a single decisive blow with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck also includes ways to dig for combo pieces and protect itself from opposing threats, making it a versatile and resilient combo deck in the Modern format.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. By using tax effects like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk, along with disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Consign to Memory, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's development and gain incremental advantage. Additionally, the deck includes various powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Hydroelectric Specimen to close out the game quickly. Overall, the deck combines aggro elements with disruptive tactics to control the game and come out ahead.
